intro: Phanera kockiana var. sericeinervia, commonly known as the silky-veined phanera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with silky, hairy veins, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
